recipes: The World Is Bigger Than You
You may abandon your selfish ambition and take up a more noble cause.
Both the artist and the astronomer look at the sky. Both the vain and the curious look for the Glory. There is little difference between the two.
Look At Yourself In The Mirror
You may forsake your old desires for the new desire blossoming within you - the inhuman beauty of the Flowers of the Apple-of-the-Eye, that grows in the Glassgarden.
The Flowers are accounted either as powerful Dead or as weak Names. They are perfect, beautiful, brittle.
This rite is the Key that will allow me to enter the Tower of Treasures. I will be changed forever.

The Rite is complete. The Marks of the Apple-of-the-Eye are upon me. The First Mark is what I have said, and the second is what I have done. If I inspect my body, I'll find the Third. My mind is gleaming with new desire.
This rite is the Key that will allow me to enter the Tower of Treasures. I will be changed forever.

The Rite is complete. The Marks of the Apple-of-the-Eye are upon me. The First Mark is what I have said, and the second is what I have done. If I inspect my body, I'll find the Third. My mind is gleaming with new desire.
Meditate on my goal of unearthly beauty
Dedicate myself with the lore of the principle I seek. I may not focus my efforts elsewhere. Not now.
Should I dedicate myself to my purpose? [Clarity is the shared dream of the Lantern and the Moth.]
I have decided to remain as I am... for now.
I will dedicate myself to the pursuit of beauty.

I've whispered the freeing words to the candle. Their every syllable is aflame - I have earned my attention. I will bleach myself to glass, so I may stand where there is light. [I have advanced a step towards a terrible ascension.]
I will dedicate myself to the pursuit of beauty.

I have spoken the words: 'Each Hour has its colour, but colour exists only where there is light.' I will bleach myself to glass, so I may stand where there is light. [I have advanced a step towards a terrible ascension.]
Hunger glows in my brain - hunger for the perfection the invisible arts might bring.
The Tower of Treasures, who is the Apple-of-the-Eye, waits in my dreams. If I learn the Moth-lore, and I dream of this temptation, I can advance my purpose. The need gnaws at me.
Even in waking hours, I have begun to glow with new colours.

My vanity is becoming a physical need. My skin will no longer bar my brilliance. It is almost time to perform the Work and begin the changes - but I must have enough Moth-aspect. Exploration might find more.
I wish to be left alone by fans and hunters both.
Time alone with myself and a mirror. That's all I need.
If I cannot confirm my ascendant beauty, my need will turn in upon itself.
A little more colour returns to my skin. I am less than I was. I need solitude, and a great many other things. But solitude comes first.
I have seen what I was, what I am, and what I may become. The Marks brighten in me.

I am almost fully transparent. Only the heart remains. I will pass through the Tricuspid Gate and I will not return. The Glorious Lie awaits me, and just beyond it is the Glory itself. My company will be perfect, beautiful, brittle. I will soon join them in their inhumanity. I will not be immortal: I will be more than that.

The Seventh Mark is the Glassgarden. I am close: close as the window to the sun's gaze. I will need all the power of Moth I can muster, as well as the power of Lantern, to at least the eighteenth and twelfth degrees of intensity.
